H0.text: Melting of the polar ice caps is the most likely result of El Niño, an oceanic phenomenon that raises surface water temperatures in the tropical Pacific Ocean and causes environmental changes.

H1.text: Varied atmospheric conditions are the most likely result of El Niño, the oceanic phenomenon in which tropical Pacific surface water temperatures increase, causing environmental changes.

H2.text: An increase in volcanic eruptions is most likely to occur as a result of El Niño, an oceanic phenomenon that raises surface water temperatures in the tropical Pacific Ocean and causes environmental changes.

H3.text: An increase in the length of summers is a likely result of El Niño, an oceanic phenomenon in which surface water temperatures rise in the tropical Pacific Ocean.

A4.text: El Niño and La Niña affect the global climate and disrupt normal weather patterns, which as a result can lead to intense storms in some places and droughts in others.
